pages.title: Practice Lumber
pages.content: I started with some maple lumber I found at a local lumber yard. It was 1.75 inch thick by about 8 inches long. The thickness was right but the width was too narrow. I'll have to glue it together to make it fit.

pages.title: Truing Up the Two Pieces
pages.content: The two pieces weren't totally true so gluing them together wouldn't work without truing them up. I tried a few passes on the table saw but it just wasn't working and they were too long to fit on my sliding miter saw. I contacted a local cabinetry shop, and the owner, John, told me to come by and he would cut the two pieces on his panel saw.

pages.title: Joining them Together
pages.content: Once the two pieces were trued up, it was just a matter of liberally applying glue and clamping them together overnight.
